name: Hotel Yak & Yeti

reviews.title: Yak and yeti hotelI enjoyed a 2 night...
reviews.text: Yak and yeti hotel

I enjoyed a 2 night stay at the yak and yeti hotel, which is supposed to be a five star but I would rate it a good four star. I had a superior room upgraded to a delux, not sure what the superior room is like but the delux was pretty standard. The bed was large (King I think) with perculier cube shaped cushions which their passing off as pillows. (They do have normal pillows which are nothing special).
reviews.title: Unhelpful staff when there is crisis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself is spacious with an on-suite which has a bath tub and shower. My flush wasn't working properly and I didn't ask for it to be repaired. I'm sure they would have had it sorted if I asked them. Don't worry I still managed to use it. The toiletries provided included shampoo, shower gel and body lotion which are quite good and enough towels to go around. The room included a 21 inch CRT tv, which had plenty of channels to keep me entertained, note that most channels are Bollywood with a few sports, news and movie channels. A fruit basket was provided but only included apples, some mangos would have been nice. I tried some at breakfast and they were delicious.
reviews.title: Too Run down

reviews.text: My room was on the 5th floor overlooking the fantastic garden, pond and swimming pool, however the pidgeons seem to rest on the window ledge and can get annoying after a while. I noticed the cleaner scraping off the pidgeon poop in the morning.
reviews.title: Yak and Yeti rocks

reviews.text: Also the bath room tiling could do with some new grout. There were no insects and overall the place is generally clean.
reviews.title: HImalayan Gateway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed several nights at this hotel, immediately after arriving to Nepal and before leaving. I wouldn't rate it as five-stars, but it's definitely a good hotel in an excellent location. It's at walking distance from the Thamel and the local market. It's very close to the Durbar Marg where you can find good restaurants.
reviews.title: Good hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: The rooms are Ok, be aware that air condition may not always work. It depends on electricity supply. The stuff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is Ok, but nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Definitely Not Worth The Money
Just ok and definitely not a 5 star hotel
reviews.text: Overall, a good place to return after spending all of the day outside.
We were told Yak & Yeti is a 5-star hotel, but I wouldn't give it more than 3-stars, that too is stretching it.
reviews.title: not upto mark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The rooms and furniture is old, the hotel needs renovation badly
reviews.title: No way a 5 star hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a regular visitor to Nepal, after a long trek I thought I would teat myself to a couple of nights here. Any sense of history in this hotel has long since evaporated. It feels under invested, crowded and shabby, with poor service.
reviews.title: Tired tourist trap

reviews.text: This hotel was a much needed relief after spending 6 days trekking Nepal and staying 3 nights in a disgusting hotel in Kathmandu. It is a beautiful property with beautiful grounds, complete with ducks and geese. The service was excellent, continental breakfast and lunch buffet was delicious and offered a variety of wonderful edibles! The only negative is that the carpet in the hallways leading into the rooms was disgustingly dirty, soiled and smelled. Why not eliminate one employee's salary and replace the carpets?
reviews.title: Great Service and beautiful property

reviews.text: Had a fantastic stay here. The garden area is a great place to relax and chill out. It far enough away from the main roads and Thamel to be very quiet and peaceful. The food and service were good. The lounge / bar area was a good place to also chill out and relax. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel Yak & Yeti was the low-light of an otherwise wonderful trip to Nepal. The worst was when I left my luggage UNLOCKED with the hotel concierge for 4 hours -- only to discover when I returned to the US that my camera was missing! The hotel management sent me a glib email saying they're certain all their employees are 100% honest -- yeah right! And then refused to help when I tried to claim the camera as lost with my travel insurance. NOT what you'd expect from a 5-star hotel. My only lesson: always keep your belongings unlocked, no matter how nice the hotel seems.
reviews.title: Not recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plus, be aware that all amenities (like the fitness room, sauna, internet) charge extra.
reviews.title: Grand & Interesting Hotel - Would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pretty skeptical of a hotel called Yak & Yeti, I have to admit. I had visions of animals in the parking lot and fake yeti rugs. No worries, tho. The staff was very professional, the lobby always cleaned (sometimes with products that had such an usual odor that they would most definitely not be legal in US, but whatever). The hotel has a reliable generator for the inevitable nightly power outages, and they aren't afraid to use it.
reviews.title: A great oasis in Kathmandu
great place to stay
reviews.text: We originally were assigned a normal room in the older wing. I would greatly recommend insisting for a room in the club level. If I remember right, it was about $40 more a night, but soooo worth it. We ate dinner some nights at the complimentary bar there and met a lot of interesting travelers we might not have otherwise got to know. Plus, the first room was a little, um, well, far from luxury. Sorta nasty-looking bedspread, unmaintained bathroom. The club level had luxury sheets, clean bath, etc.
Location was great -- close to Tamel but not too close. Would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Hotel that feels more like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: superb location, nice n friendly staffs...especially thier Masala Tea.....must have>>
reviews.title: An Oasis in the middle of Kathmandu

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week for a conference.
reviews.title: Aways Enjoyable

description: Hotel Yak and Yeti, is a luxury 5-star deluxe hotel in the heart of Kathmandu, Nepal. Modern day sophistication greets cultural heritage in the ample grounds of the 100-year-old palace and newly designed structure of the hotel. Find refuge among antique fountains, gilded temples and emerald gardens as you remain just moments away from all the shops and adventure of the Kathmandu city, located at Durbar Marg, Kathmandu, Nepal
